blocks.content: 3.1 AI Tools Overview
The number of AI tools is growing rapidly, each with different strengths. Below is an introduction with practical examples to help you understand *when to use which tool*.
🧑‍💻 For Programming and Development
ChatGPT 5

GPT-5 stands out for **reasoning ability** and **multimodality**. Best for:
- Large-scale code explanation and refactoring
- Security audits (SQL Injection, XSS)
- System design and architecture advice
- Debugging images + text issues

blocks.title: Example Prompt
blocks.content: You are a **senior security auditor**. Please review the following Python API, identify possible SQL Injection risks, and suggest fixes.

blocks.title: Limitations
blocks.content: GPT-5 requires a paid subscription; multimodal features may not be available on all platforms.
Cursor (with CLI)

Cursor is not only an AI IDE but also provides a **CLI tool** to directly work with entire codebases:
- Auto-generate project structure explanations
- Fix specific files
- Conduct full code reviews

blocks.title: Cursor CLI Example
blocks.content:
$ cursor explain src/
$ cursor fix src/utils.py
$ cursor review src/

items.content: Install Cursor and try `cursor explain` on an open-source repo
Use `cursor fix` to repair a faulty Python file

blocks.content: Claude Code

Claude Code excels at **long context (100k tokens)**, making it suitable for:
- Reading an entire project at once
- Multi-perspective analysis with Sub-agents (security / performance / docs)
- Security reviews

blocks.title: Sub-agent Prompt Example
blocks.content:
You are a **security expert agent**. Please review this Node.js project:
1. Check if dependencies have vulnerabilities
2. Verify if APIs defend against SQL Injection
3. Suggest fixes

blocks.title: Notes
blocks.content: Claude Code has strong analysis but slower output than Cursor. Better for large debugging or long document reviews.
📊 API Tokens
When using AI models (e.g., GPT, Claude, Cursor), your program must communicate with the AI server. Servers do not allow unlimited access, so an API token is required:

items: Identity: Confirms who the user is and if valid.
Permissions: Defines which features and resources are available.
Billing: Providers track usage via tokens for charges or quota deductions.

blocks.title: Legend
blocks.content: ✅ = Strong support; ⚠️ = Partial / Limited; ❌ = Not supported
Summary

blocks.title: Summary
blocks.content: The value of AI tools = **multimodality + long context + memory + strong reasoning**. Used effectively, they can serve as mentor, analyst, and collaborator. The next chapter will dive deeper into different AI tools and less-discussed details.
